paths

Class Arc

  • java.lang.Object
    • paths.Path
      • paths.Arc
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants, Drawable

    public class Arc
extends Path
    A path drawn along the perimeter of an arc.
    Author:
    James Morrow [jamesmorrowdesign.com]

    • Constructor Detail

      • Arc

        public Arc(Arc arc)
        Copy constructor.
        Parameters:
        arc - the arc to copy

      • Arc

        public Arc(float a,
           float b,
           float c,
           float d,
           float startAngle,
           float endAngle,
           int ellipseMode)
        Constructs an Arc analogously to Processing's native arc() function. See the Processing documentation for more information.
        Parameters:
        a - the 1st arc argument, whose meaning is determined by the given ellipseMode
        b - the 2nd arc argument, whose meaning is determined by the given ellipseMode
        c - the 3rd arc argument, whose meaning is determined by the given ellipseMode
        d - the 4th arc argument, whose meaning is determined by the given ellipseMode
        startAngle - the angle at which to start the arc
        endAngle - the angle at which to start the arc
        ellipseMode - determines the meaning of a,b,c, and d and can be of value RADIUS, CENTER, CORNER, or CORNERS

      • Arc

        public Arc(float x,
           float y,
           float r)
        Easy constructor.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the path
        y - The y-coordinate of the path
        r - The maximum radius of the path

    • Method Detail

      • setEllipse

        public void setEllipse(float a,
                       float b,
                       float c,
                       float d,
                       int ellipseMode)
        Sets the position and size of the ellipse underlying the arc.
        Parameters:
        a - the 1st ellipse argument, whose meaning is determined by the given ellipseMode
        b - the 2nd ellipse argument, whose meaning is determined by the given ellipseMode
        c - the 3rd ellipse argument, whose meaning is determined by the given ellipseMode
        d - the 4th ellipse argument, whose meaning is determined by the given ellipseMode
        ellipseMode - Determines the meaning of a, b, c, and d. The ellipseMode can be CENTER, RADIUS, CORNER, or CORNERS

      • setEllipse

        public void setEllipse(Point ab,
                       float c,
                       float d,
                       int ellipseMode)
        Sets the position and size of the ellipse underlying the arc.
        Parameters:
        ab - the 1st and 2nd ellipse arguments, whose meaning is determined by the given ellipseMode
        c - the 3rd ellipse argument, whose meaning is determined by the given ellipseMode
        d - the 4th ellipse argument, whose meaning is determined by the given ellipseMode
        ellipseMode - Determines the meaning of a, b, c, and d. The ellipseMode can be CENTER, RADIUS, CORNER, or CORNERS.

      • setEllipse

        public void setEllipse(Point ab,
                       Point cd,
                       int ellipseMode)
        Sets the position and size of the ellipse underlying the arc.
        Parameters:
        ab - the 1st and 2nd arc arguments, whose meaning is determined by the given ellipseMode
        cd - the 3rd and 4th arc argument, whose meaning is determined by the given ellipseMode
        ellipseMode - Determines the meaning of a, b, c, and d. The ellipseMode can be CENTER, RADIUS, CORNER, or CORNERS.

      • trace

        public void trace(Point pt,
                  float u)
        Description copied from class: Path
        Given a 1D coordinate, a float, maps the coordinate to a 2D coordinate and stores it in a given Point.

        Maps a given floating point number within [0, 1) to a given Point along the perimeter of the Path.
        Specified by:
        trace in class Path
        Parameters:
        pt - The Point in which the result is stored.
        u - A number within [0, 1)

        Specified by:
        translate in class Path
        Parameters:
        dx - The number of pixels to shift the path right.
        dy - The number of pixels to shift the path down.
